items.headline: Trump floats idea of $2,000 tariff dividend checks to most Americans
items.summary_en: President Donald Trump on Sunday floated the idea of payments of at least $2,000 to most Americans to show the benefits of his tariff policy.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: U.S. stock futures rise amid new hope of imminent deal to end government shutdown
items.summary_en: U.S. stock futures gained Sunday, despite coming off the worst week for tech stocks since April, as investors clung to indications that a deal may be in the works to end the government shutdown.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I have $12K in credit-card debt due to health issues and a 30% pay cut. Is it finally time to take a loan from my 401(k)?

items.headline: My siblings don’t earn nearly as much as me. Should my parents leave me less money in their will?

items.headline: ‘We can’t afford to buy a house’: My husband and I are building a house on my mother-in-law’s land. Are we asking for trouble?
items.summary_en: “A single-family home where we live costs $600,000 or more.”

items.headline: I’m 83 and will have $500K if I sell my house. My estranged wife wants me to join her in Colombia. Do I go?
items.summary_en: “I can just barely handle my expenses with a mortgage payment of $984 and an income of $3,800.”

items.headline: My girlfriend, a widow in her 40s, pays off her credit card after every transaction. Is that weird?
